paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: LQT syndrome; daughter symptomatic, mother asymptomatic

individual_records.evidence_sentence: iPSCs were obtained from a fifteen-year-old female that showed symptoms of LQT syndrome and carried the missense c.1681G>A (p.A561T) mutation in KCNH2.
iPSCs were obtained from a fifteen-year-old female that showed symptoms of LQT syndrome and her mother who was an asymptomatic carrier of the mutation.

functional_data.summary: Cardiomyocytes from both individuals showed prolonged field/action potential duration compared to control cells.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The daughter had a more pronounced elongation of the action potential compared to her mother.
key_quotes: Cardiomyocytes obtained from both daughter's and mother's iPSCs showed prolonged field/action potential duration as compared to control cells.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient-specific iPSCs carrying different mutations in KCNH2 that encodes alpha-subunit of I_Kr channels have been generated.

functional_data.summary: Electrophysiological studies revealed a decrease in I_Kr and increase in action potential duration.

variants.additional_notes: The specific patient details were not provided.
key_quotes: Electrophysiological studies of the iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes revealed a number of pathological manifestations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
